abstracts.cdata!:
The ratings for the Fourth Economic
            Assistance Grant for Kosovo Project were as follows: the
            outcome was satisfactory, the sustainability was likely, the
            institutional development impact was substantial, and the
            Bank and borrower performance were both satisfactory. One of
            the positive lessons to learn from the success of the
            project is the ability of a relatively small budget support
            operation to generate significant leverage over policy and
            legislative reforms. Changes in the key counterparts in
            United Nations Interim Administration Mission in Kosovo
            (UNMIK), and the Provisional Institutions of Self-Government
            (PISG) can adversely impact the commitment to the
            medium-term policy agenda. More generally, a one tranche
            budget support operation uses all of its leverage up front.
            The other lesson learned is the importance of linking key
            conditions in adjustment operations with the technical
            assistance programs of other donors.
